@selfstyledsiren @kphipps3000 We should acknowledge that a major problem with modern blockbusters isn‚Äôt superheroes and shared universes, but the lack of practical effects and sense of place in movies. The stories aren‚Äôt any worse than anything else made in the past 40 years.

@selfstyledsiren @kphipps3000 I am commenting on the idea that Scorsese and Coppola are similar just because they made mafia movies. Those movies are wildly different. Coppola also has a significantly more diverse filmography. 

The MCU turns out bland visuals, but so does 90% of cinema compared to Scorsese.

@kphipps3000 Coppola is weird and interesting. Scorsese is a great pop entertainer, but closer to the MCU than people are willing to acknowledge. Lumping those two together is as lopsided as any comments either makes about current popcorn movies.
